Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, it was observed that the fire extinguisher in the entrance hallway to have been used or has lost operating pressure.  The extinguisher must be serviced or replaced immediately with an equivalent unit.
Correction Narrative: The GRO responded with corrections by email and a photo dated 03/09/2023 displaying that the red stem that was cited on 03/07/2023 for the fire extinguisher in the entrance hallway that was used or lost operating pressure due to a monthly fire drill has been replaced and now showing compliance with a green stem now showing.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver restrained a child by dragging him by his feet while another staff member grabbed his arms immediately after the child had fallen several feet onto a hard floor.
Correction Narrative: This follow up was done by inspection. Please refer to Inspection #3925929. Chrono was also entered for this follow up. The agency followed up by changing from MANDT to TCI for the children in care, care giver responsibilities have been re-given to staff to read and sign again, cellphone policy all staff resigned. Staff and children were interviewed and confirmed training on new Restraint methods. Children had no concerns and made no outcries.

Staff and children were interviewed and confirmed training on new Restraint methods. Children had no concerns and made no outcries.

Deficiency Narrative: During the course of the investigation this standard was found to be deficient. A Supervisor at the operation ordered the staff to perform a restraint as a means to get the child to comply or as means to discipline the child. The child was not a harm to himself or anyone else at the time of the request.
Correction Narrative: The agency has responded with an email on staff being re-trained on restraint protocols. All newly hired staff will also be trained as well to ensure safety in the future. a physical FWUP was  conducted on 2/6/23 #3926386 and staff and children were interviewed as well in reference to restraint or being mistreated there were no concerns.

Deficiency Narrative: Three children expressed being restrained with their arms behind their back.
Correction Narrative: The agency will continue to self report in accordance with minimum standards. The new de-escalation training TCI was rolled out onto the floor as of 10/4/22 all staff were retrained.

Deficiency Narrative: During this inspection it was found that this standard was found deficient and not complete by the agency.
Correction Narrative: The agency responded with corrections by email on how they will ensure all staff will conduct a debriefing discussion with the victim and maintaining records by completing the physical restraint report based on the standard within 48 hours.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation of this standard was found to be deficient based on the statement of the victim and a collateral staff supporting he was in pain  during the restraint and was treated after with an ice pack.
Correction Narrative:
A follow up was completed for and staff and children were interviewed. Staff took trauma informed care and children were interviewed and confirmed no restraints or concerns. Staff stated that they discipline the children by using verbal warnings and then possible write and level drop
Serious incidents will be sent via email due to access limited with several staff being absent.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation it was found that the agency failed to report a serious incident to parents/caseworker in a timely manner on several incidents involving the victim.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation this standard was found to be deficient due to a staff performing a prone/supine restraint without attempting a less restrictive intervention first.
Correction Narrative: The agency has responded with compliance and ensuring safety for all children in care by implementing a new de-escalation technique called TCI. All staff and new staff have been trained with TCI by the agency and there has been a decreased in restraints since then. The agency has address concerns by re-training staff on how to de-escalate behaviors and do not use of profane language by monitoring the units closer with audio and cameras. Staff will held accountable by agency to follow rules at all times. During the follow -up inspection staff and children were interviewed to ensure compliance has been met and no concerns with restraints and profanity were expressed.

Deficiency Narrative: Excessive force was used during a restraint
Correction Narrative:
During the follow up inspection I interviewed five children residing at the operation. Five of the five kids interviewed stated that they have not been hurt during a restraint and did not feel any pain during restraints. The operation has re-trained staff on the appropriate use of force during a restraint and is continuing training for further development. 

Staff involved in allegation was terminated due to using inappropriate restraints.

Deficiency Narrative: During a restraint, child in care arms where put behind the back
The health inspection provided was expired 8/31/21
Correction Narrative: An email was received containing the Health Inspection documentation. The documentation appeared to be updated. Compliance has been met.

Deficiency Narrative: Caregivers s failed to adhere to the child's rights to be free of abuse, neglect, and exploitation as defined in Texas Family Code 261.001(4) (A)(iv) and §261.001(1)(C)
Correction Narrative: CCR inspector received the following from the LCCA: All DCC staff members will receive in-service and annual trainings on how to appropriately respond to Crisis situations and how to report any acts of abuse and neglect.  DCC will continue to train and support all staff members through this process and exhaust all efforts to ensure the children of DCC are safe and free of abuse and neglect. The LCCA stated the notifications to parent/Managing conservators were sent.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member utilized corporal punishment when a child in care was choked.
Correction Narrative: CCR inspector received the following from the LCAA:Corporal punishment is not tolerated at DCC. Shift Supervisors to revisit this standard and have the staff to sign of stating that they have received and understand this information. I will also make sure that the documentation states who is responsible for monitoring these actions. CCR confirmed staff involved were terminated

Deficiency Narrative: Staff failed to utilize prudent judgement and self- control while performing assigned tasks, when staff became physically aggressive with a child in care. Additionally, staff was negligent in failing to intervene when this occurred.
Correction Narrative: RCCR inspector received the following information from the LCCA: The staff member in question has been deemed unable to perform job functions at DCC. The incident was unprovoked and came without warning. DCC staff are trained thoroughly on the use of EBI and the behaviors that warrant the usage of physical restraints. Staff member in question was placed on administrative leave the day of incident and upon further investigation was terminated from DCC and is no ineligible for rehire. CCR verified that both staff have been listed as inactive and terminated.

Deficiency Narrative: Children in care were sleeping in the gymnasium due to construction at the operation. Licensing was not aware.
Correction Narrative: A phone call was held with the operation's Administrator, following an email received on 8/22/21 with the corrective action. The corrective action entailed that staff are to be trained on the areas of concern, where they are deficient. Additionally, the operation will be given a refresher course on reporting to be sure they are operating within the guidelines of the minimum standards to prevent posing risks to children in care.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walk through it was observed that 7 mattresses were missing mattress covers at the operation.
Correction Narrative:
7/6/21-TCT the operation and email to the operation for corrections for this follow up, requesting copies of the receipts for the bedding mattress covers/correction plans. -LG
I received a response from the LCCA, Darien Phillips: This information has been corrected and we will continue to monitor the situation. The children complain that the mattress covers are hot and uncomfortable. We have placed a requisition in to upgrade mattresses but until then we have allocated shifts and personnel to be responsible for ensuring the mattress covers are replaced when need. -LG

Deficiency Narrative: Residents admitted to kissing. At the time of the incident, the staff were administering medication and monitoring calls. The additional duties interfered with the staff ability to supervise the residents.
Correction Narrative:
RCC did a follow up on Investigation 2722345. Did a walk through and received staff roster. Facility was compliant. Administrator just hired 3 new employees. They were on ratio. 
No citations were given.
on 4/12/2021, Administrator emailed me corrective action.
I.	Administrator had assigned substantial amount of staff to provide coverage for the shift to operate according to schedule. Incident occurred during med pass and preparation for bedtime programing. 
II.	Shift Supervisors will ensure dorms are adequately staffed during peak hours to ensure proper supervision.
III.	Staff members have been reminded that during med pass the staff member administering meds will not be counted in ratio at any time.

Deficiency Narrative: There were several beds, on both the boys and girls side, that did not have any mattress covers.
Correction Narrative: The children find the bed covers uncomfortable and rip them off the mattress. We have replaced the bed covers and have requested replacement mattress with moisture resistant mattresses for a more long term fix.

Deficiency Narrative: The staff member confirmed that she had and was observed conducting an inappropriate restraint due to a child refusing to get up from the floor were he was laying.
Correction Narrative:
On 03/01/2021 RCC received notification that employee was terminated on 2/24/2021.

The Inspector AR granted an extension. The agency has until 2/17/2021 to submit their corrections.

On 03/01/2021 RCC received notification that employee was terminated on 2/24/2021. 


The Inspector AR granted an extension. The agency has until 2/17/2021 to submit their corrections.

Deficiency Narrative: During a restraint, child in care arms where put behind the back
Excessive force was used during a restraint
During overnight shift if a staff member leaves an assign work area the other staff cannot properly see or hear the other kids in the room
Correction Narrative: Overnight staff is not to perform any work duties like washing clothes and cleaning while supervising the residents at night

Deficiency Narrative:
Agency failed to report serious incident timely 
The oldest victim disclose the incident to staff on 11/04/2020. The agency did not report the incident  until 11/13/2020
Correction Narrative: Staff members and supervisor will be retrained on reporting abuse and neglect. The staff received the training on 2/12/2021.
